properties.areaDesc: Southwest Chaves County; South Central Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 3 at 3:04AM MST until March 4 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...QUICK BOUT OF WINTRY WEATHER POSSIBLE ACROSS SOUTH CENTRAL NEW
MEXICO TONIGHT...

.Several inches of snow is possible late this afternoon through
Wednesday morning across the South Central Mountains and portions
of southwest Chaves County. Periods of moderate to heavy snow may
result in slick and icy roadways, especially across higher
elevations. Snow will diminish or turn to rain by mid day
Wednesday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5
inches below 7500 feet, and up to 10 inches above 7500 feet
possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph across southwest
Chaves County early Wednesday.

* WHERE...South Central Mountains and Southwest Chaves County.

* WHEN...From late this afternoon through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, including along U.S.
Highways 380 and 70 and State Highways 48 and 37.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels near 6000 feet by early
Wednesday morning will result in a sharp gradient of snow across
Southwest Chaves County. Eastern portions of this area may
receive little to no snow, but western areas may receive a few
to several inches. Rapidly changing road conditions are
possible along Highway 82 from east to west.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
